member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.Abandon
member.summary: Terminates the storyboard, releases all related animation variables, and removes the storyboard from the schedule.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.AddKeyframeAfterTransition
member.summary: Adds a keyframe at the end of the specified transition.
member.param: The transition after which a keyframe is to be added.
The keyframe to be added.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
The transition has not been added to the storyboard.

returns.para: See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.AddKeyframeAtOffset
member.summary: Adds a keyframe at the specified offset from an existing keyframe.
member.param: The existing keyframe. To add a keyframe at an offset from the start of the storyboard, use the special keyframe UI_ANIMATION_KEYFRAME_STORYBOARD_START.
The offset from the existing keyframe at which a new keyframe is to be added.
The keyframe to be added.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.AddTransition
member.summary: Adds a transition to the storyboard.
member.param: The animation variable for which the transition is to be added.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
This transition has already been added to a storyboard.

returns.para: See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.AddTransitionAtKeyframe
member.summary: Adds a transition that starts at the specified keyframe.
member.param: The animation variable for which a transition is to be added.
The transition to be added.
The keyframe that specifies the beginning of the new transition.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
This transition has already been added to a storyboard or has been added to a storyboard that has finished playing and been released.
The transition might eclipse the beginning of another transition in the storyboard.

returns.para: See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.AddTransitionBetweenKeyframes
member.summary: Adds a transition between two keyframes.
member.param: The animation variable for which the transition is to be added.
The transition to be added.
A keyframe that specifies the beginning of the new transition.
A keyframe that specifies the end of the new transition. It must not be possible for endKeyframe to appear earlier in the storyboard than startKeyframe.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
This transition has already been added to a storyboard or has been added to a storyboard that has finished playing and been released.
The transition might eclipse the beginning of another transition in the storyboard.
The start keyframe might occur after the end keyframe.

returns.para: See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.Conclude
member.summary: Completes the current iteration of a keyframe loop that is in progress (where the loop is set to UI_ANIMATION_REPEAT_INDEFINITELY), terminates the loop, and continues with the storyboard.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.Finish
member.summary: Finishes the storyboard within the specified time, compressing the storyboard if necessary.
member.param: The maximum amount of time that the storyboard can use to finish playing.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.GetElapsedTime
member.summary: Gets the time that has elapsed since the storyboard started playing.
member.param: The elapsed time.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
The storyboard is not playing.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.GetStatus
member.summary: Gets the status of the storyboard.
member.param: The storyboard status.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.GetTag
member.summary: Gets the tag for a storyboard.
member.param: The object portion of the tag.
The identifier portion of the tag.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
The storyboard tag was not set.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.HoldVariable
member.summary: Directs the storyboard to hold the specified animation variable at its final value until the storyboard ends.
member.param: The animation variable.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.RepeatBetweenKeyframes
member.summary: Creates a loop between two keyframes.
member.param: The keyframe at which the loop is to begin.
The keyframe at which the loop is to end. endKeyframe must not occur earlier in the storyboard than startKeyframe.

The number of times the loop is to be repeated; the last iteration of a loop can terminate fractionally between keyframes. A value of zero indicates that the specified portion of a storyboard will not be played. A value of UI_ANIMATION_REPEAT_INDEFINITELY (-1) indicates that the loop will repeat indefinitely until the storyboard is trimmed or concluded.

param.name: repeatMode
param.para: The pattern for the loop iteration.
A value of (1) specifies that the start of the loop must alternate between keyframes (k1->k2, k2->k1, k1->k2, and so on).
A value of (0) specifies that the start of the loop must begin with the first keyframe (k1->k2, k1->k2, k1->k2, and so on).
param.div: Note If repeatMode has a value of (1) and cRepetition has a value of UI_ANIMATION_REPEAT_INDEFINITELY (-1), the loop terminates on the end keyframe.

member.param: The handler for each loop iteration event. The default value is 0.
The loop ID to pass to pIterationChangeHandler. The default value is 0.

If true, specifies that pIterationChangeHandler will be incorporated into the estimate of the time interval until the next animation event that is returned by the method. The default value is 0, or false.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.Schedule
member.summary: Directs the storyboard to schedule itself for play.
member.param: The current time.
The result of the scheduling request. You can omit this parameter from calls to this method.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.SetLongestAcceptableDelay
member.summary: Sets the longest acceptable delay before the scheduled storyboard begins.
member.param: The longest acceptable delay. This parameter can be a positive value, or UI_ANIMATION_SECONDS_EVENTUALLY (-1) to indicate that any finite delay is acceptable.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.SetSkipDuration
member.summary: Specifies an offset from the beginning of a storyboard at which to start animating.
member.param: The offset, or amount of time, to skip at the beginning of the storyboard.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.SetStoryboardEventHandler
member.summary: Specifies a handler for storyboard events.

param.name: handler
param.para: The handler that Windows Animation should call whenever storyboard status and update events occur.
The specified object must implement the interface or be NULL. See Remarks for more info.

member.param: If TRUE, registers the event and includes those events in , which estimates the time interval until the next animation event. No default value.
If TRUE, registers the event and includes those events in , which estimates the time interval until the next animation event. No default value.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard2.SetTag
member.summary: Sets the tag for the storyboard.
member.param:
The object portion of the tag.
This parameter can be NULL.
The identifier portion of the tag.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

summary.para:
Defines a storyboard, which contains a group of transitions that are synchronized relative to one another.
In this section

listheader.description: Topic
Description
Terminates the storyboard, releases all related animation variables, and removes the storyboard from the schedule.
Adds a keyframe at the end of the specified transition.
Adds a keyframe at the specified offset from an existing keyframe.
Adds a transition to the storyboard.
Adds a transition that starts at the specified keyframe.
Adds a transition between two keyframes.
Completes the current iteration of a keyframe loop that is in progress (where the loop is set to UI_ANIMATION_REPEAT_INDEFINITELY), terminates the loop, and continues with the storyboard.
Finishes the storyboard within the specified time, compressing the storyboard if necessary.
Gets the time that has elapsed since the storyboard started playing.
Gets the status of the storyboard.
Gets the tag for a storyboard.
Directs the storyboard to hold the specified animation variable at its final value until the storyboard ends.
Creates a loop between two keyframes.
Directs the storyboard to schedule itself for play.
Specifies an offset from the beginning of a storyboard at which to start animating.
Sets the longest acceptable delay before the scheduled storyboard begins.
Specifies a handler for storyboard events.
Sets the tag for the storyboard.
